domain

Class HuffNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.HuffNode

  • public class HuffNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a node in a Huffman tree.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HuffNode.ByCanonicalOrder
      Compares HuffNodes by canonical order: first by codeword length (in ascending order), then by symbol (in alphabetical order).
      static class  HuffNode.ByWeight
      Compares HuffNodes by weight, in ascending order.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HuffNode(java.lang.Byte symbol)
      Constructor for leaf nodes.
      HuffNode(java.lang.Byte symbol, long weight)
      Constructor for leaf nodes.
      HuffNode(HuffNode leftChild, HuffNode rightChild)
      Constructor for internal nodes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • HuffNode

        public HuffNode(java.lang.Byte symbol)
        Constructor for leaf nodes. It creates a new HuffNode instance corresponding to the given symbol.
        Parameters:
        symbol - A symbol in the original alphabet (8-bit alphabet); if this HuffNode is an internal node (not a leaf), symbol should be null.

      • HuffNode

        public HuffNode(java.lang.Byte symbol,
                long weight)
        Constructor for leaf nodes. It creates a new HuffNode instance corresponding to the given symbol.
        Parameters:
        symbol - A symbol in the original alphabet (8-bit alphabet); if this HuffNode is an internal node (not a leaf), symbol should be null.
        weight - Number of occurrences of the given symbol in the original data.

      • HuffNode

        public HuffNode(HuffNode leftChild,
                HuffNode rightChild)
        Constructor for internal nodes. It creates a new HuffNode instance corresponding to the given symbol.
        Parameters:
        leftChild - The node's left child.
        rightChild - The node's right child.

    • Method Detail

      • isLeaf

        public boolean isLeaf()
        Returns true if this node is a leaf node. This means that it was created using a constructor for leaf nodes, and thus getSymbol() will return a non-null value.
        Returns:
        True if this node is a leaf node, and thus its variable symbol has a non-null value.
